text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with no need pizza dough the pizza
dough video on the site which i did a
million years ago has been one of the
most popular videos and so I thought I
would repost it using the no need
technique that I've fallen in love with
this is so easy you got to try this
quarter teaspoon of yeast dry active
yeast one and a half cups of tepid water
that's just over room temperature just
barely warm one teaspoon and a quarter
of salt quarter teaspoon of sugar 1/2 a
cup of wheat flour and then two and a
half cups of white flour so we're gonna
have just a little bit of wheat in there
just to give it a little bit of extra
something and then the white flour
that's just regular all-purpose flour
unbleached of course now I should have
put in two tablespoons olive oil here
but I was too busy stirring and I
totally forgot it doesn't really matter
as long as it's in there but just put it
in when you put it in all the other
liquid ingredients and things will be a
little easier for you but you'll see I
work that in and it was no big deal and
you see that texture we want you to pay
attention to that texture see it's kind
of stiff but extremely sticky alright
it's not runny so if you have to add a
little more flour feel free I'm gonna
cover that with plastic wrap I'm gonna
put a few small holes in it alright
we're gonna leave that I just left mine
in an empty oven for 12 hours and that's
what it looks like when it's done
all right I'm gonna scrape it onto a
well floured board very well floured and
you'll see it's so glutinous that'll
scrape right out of that bowl pretty
much clean because it really wants to
stick to itself okay so it's on the
floured board
you're gonna flour the top of it
generously and just Pat it down that
kind of presses out all the air bubbles
I'm going to cut it into four with my
little pastry cutter here and I'm going
to take each quarter and just kind of
roll it up
I'm going to fold them into these like
round little loaves I'm gonna put it
seem side down on the board and you're
ready to make pizza now I'm gonna put a
couple away here you can easily just
keep these in the fridge for a couple
days and plastic wrap like that
not a problem all right now to make
pizza pretty easy we're gonna press that
out to like a round shape you can spin
it if you want a lot of people like
stretching it over the backs of their
hands like this but you know just grab a
roller roll it out big deal alright from
one of those quarters of this dough
recipe you're gonna get about a nine or
ten inch diameter pizza crust this has a
little six inch ruler on this cutter so
that's about nine inches all right now
here's the trick you want a sprinkle
cornmeal and Pat it in on the dough
itself we're also gonna sprinkle
cornmeal a lot of it onto this baking
sheet because this pizza dough will
stick you want to put a really good
amount of cornmeal down like you see
there almost covered then you're gonna
flip it over put the cornmeal side down
onto the pan and that's gonna be perfect
all right I'm making a white garlic
pizza
alright so no tomatoes will be harmed in
the making of this pizza I'm simply
gonna take two cloves of garlic crush
them mix it with about a tablespoon of
olive oil and spread that all over this
crust already you can tell it's gonna be
great
anybody got a mint I'm gonna put some
black pepper on there you might want to
get a little sprinkling of salt always a
good idea
some dry oregano you can certainly use
fresh herbs if you want of course then
I'm gonna take pepper jack cheese use
any cheese you want but I like pepper
jack is a little kick it's a great
melting cheese alright we're gonna top
that with just a nice dusting of
parmesan and that's it alright so this
is gonna go in a preheated 450 degree
oven we're gonna put it right on the
bottom of the oven for about six minutes
and that's gonna kind of get that bottom
crust nice and toasty and charred a
little bit so after the six minutes
you're gonna take it off the bottom of
the oven you can see the bottom forming
there nicely move it to the middle of
the oven it's only going to go three or
four more minutes
alright the outside is going to be nice
and crispy and crusty the inside chewy
and delicious I'm gonna top of some
green onions because it's
garlic pizza so anyway there it is look
at the bottom crisp nicely browned the
center has those beautiful air bubbles
the chewy top what a great pizza dough
recipe so what did I do with that other
piece there egg pizza oh yeah those
who's still following the old piece of
dough recipe on the site just forget

you're gonna love it you're gonna be
able to make pizza dough on a regular
